Articles.Content: I've lost countless solar panels to physics loading. We can repair wheels, so why not solar panels?

Even the way KAS does it (only without random physics sending your poor Kerbals into interplanetary space at random intervals) where you have to bring up a new solar panel and replace the one you unfairly lost would be great.

I don't think you'd be able to repair the panels without replacing them, as when they break, they break completely off.

Being able to replace them (apart from docking another set on) would be great, though.

I don't think you'd be able to repair the panels without replacing them, as when they break, they break completely off.

I dunno, as it is they seem to be held on with magnets or velcro rather than bolts. So should just be a matter of finding the popped off panel, sticking it back on and plugging in the power connector.
